+Veritasium i'm just letting you know there's a problem with the uranium documentary you made, the bomb you indicated was the uranium bomb (sometime around ~41 min into the first episode), little boy, was actually the plutonium bomb which fired a plutonium slug into a plutonium sheath creating a critical mass for a chain reaction at regular density, the one behind you, fat man, was the uranium bomb, which compressed the uranium 235 using conventional explosives to achieve critical density for a chain reaction with less mass.

In short, yes. The long answer: yes it does.
Time does slow down the faster you move, it has been proven many times. See Gravitational_time_dilation on en dot wiki pedia dot org for more info.
I noticed you are now on Patreon, patreon dot com slash veritasium , why not advertise that somewhere?

Time does not slows down. It's only the perspective of one, experiencing a speed, looking at other things, experiencing different speeds, that makes time look slowed down/speed up.

If you're on earth moving at speed of light, you will never see all the others beeing "paused", you would just be damn far from earth by the fact that you are MOVING.

Saying that lightspeed slows time down is not a fact, it's just a theory. Talking about time travel, we might also talk about the existance of a god.

What is time to a photon?  That sounds more like a philosophical question.   A photon is not like a rock or a ripple in a pond.  Nor is it a combination of the two.  It is so far from our experience that it is not useful to think of it in terms of our macro world.  Like Schrodinger's Cat, thinking of the quantum world in terms of the everyday world that we live in, is a barrier to understanding.

Don't listen to daddymoist. Light is not a particle. Light is more like a ghost, the only evidence of its' existence is its' effect. Try to catch some light in a clay pot. You caught nothing, it was gone before you got it. Don't even think about light having a begining or end or life span. Light doesn"t have a perspective or aspect point. Light is everywhere and nowhere. Light is the moment of Gods self awareness projected as the universe. Your question is unanswerable. Don't listen to me.
And that moment is named "Eternity".
How long can light travel?

I think it's the opposite! It exists FOREVER xD No, really, I mean, atoms decay, even protons decay with time, but photons are ultimately stable, they don't "die" unless they hit something and lose energy. Apparently, there's no time for them, the time just doesn't go for photons... that is very hard to imagine...

I've wondered this before - does light experience only space and not time... I don't know if it's really fair to ask such things since light doesn't have consciousness, but it is interesting to think about...
